main event: A civilian observed two unidentified objects in the sky over Dayton, Ohio on December 1, 1953, for approximately 15 minutes.
interesting points: The objects appeared as flashing lights without sound,They were observed to be stationary for the duration of the sighting,The report concluded that there was insufficient data for evaluation, Jupiter, Venus, and Mars were below the horizon at the time of observation, The observer described the color of the objects as whitish or greyish luminous.
